content.description: Squat start with a left hand on the arete and a right hand jug. From there, work up through a pair of edges, gain a shallow hueco, match a hand next to it on an edge, pogo up a foot to an edge, commit to the arete above, and mantel onto the slab.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. The immediate landing is very good, but there is a large juniper tree directly behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs the north side of Alpha's northeast arete.

content.description:
Stand start matched on a chest high jug. From there, move to a pair of jugs, reach a left hand crimp on the arete, move to the right hand crimp before the lip, and mantel on top the boulder.

The moves before the lip a very reach-dependent.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. The landing is good.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Alpha's southeast arete.

content.description: Stand start with hands matched three feet from the ground on the sketchy shelf.  From there, work out the roof to the jugs, then make a big move to the lip, rein in the cut, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A few pads, the landing is very good.
content.location: This is on the East face of Alpha Boulder.

content.description: Stand start with a pair of good waist-high edge-jugs. From there, make a big reach to a right hand bump, follow to the hueco-jug, match on it, gain the lip, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work. The landing has a nasty rock directly behind the problem.
content.location:
It climbs the east face of Alpha, just to the right of

Foxtrot Tango

.
